description: Replacement of fifteen single glazed windows with painted timber frames at the ground, first and loft floor levels with fifteen double glazed windows with painted timber frames
decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990.

| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title number(s) Drawing No. 1, dated 03/12/2017; Drawing No. 2, dated 03/12/2017;  Drawing No. 3, dated 03/12/2017;  Drawing No. 4, dated 03/12/2017;  Drawing No. 5, dated 03/12/2017;  Drawing No. 6, dated 03/12/2017;  Drawing No. 7, dated 03/12/2017.
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.

| The materials to be used for windows shall match the appearance of those of the existing windows, and shall be consistent with those as listed within the submitted application form and the drawings / plans as listed in Condition (2).

REASON: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with Policies 7.4 & 7.6 of the London Plan (2016) and Policies 7.4, 7.6 and 7B of Adopted Ealing Development Management Plan Document (2013), polices 1.1 (k) and 1.2 (f) of the adopted Development (Core) Strategy (2013) and the Brentham Garden Estate Conservation Area Management Plan (2007).
| Window Spacers shall blend in with the white colour of the windows and shall not be visible from the streetscape.

REASON: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with Policies 7.4 & 7.6 of the London Plan (2016) and Policies 7.4, 7.6 and 7B of Adopted Ealing Development Management Plan Document (2013), polices 1.1 (k) and 1.2 (f) of the adopted Development (Core) Strategy (2013), and the Brentham Garden Estate Conservation Area Management Plan (2007).
